description: The dashboard sections are supposed to be reorderable via drag-and-drop, but dragging a section and dropping it on another position does nothing. The sections stay in their original order no matter how many times you try.
expectedOutcome: Dragging a dashboard section (e.g. 'Key Metrics') and dropping it onto another section (e.g. 'Recent Activity') should reorder them — the dropped section should appear at the new position.
hint: Look at the drag-and-drop event handlers in DashboardBuilder.jsx — check what handleDragOver does (or doesn't do), and how the sections array is being updated in handleDrop.
solution:
There are two bugs in src/components/DashboardBuilder.jsx:

Bug 1 — Line 102-103 (handleDragOver is empty):
The handleDragOver function body is empty. The HTML5 Drag and Drop API requires e.preventDefault() to be called on the 'dragover' event for an element to become a valid drop target. Without it, the browser blocks the drop and the onDrop handler never fires.

Fix: Add e.preventDefault() inside handleDragOver on line 103.

Bug 2 — Line 109 (direct state mutation in handleDrop):
'const reordered = sections' copies the array reference, not the array itself. The .splice() calls on lines 110-111 mutate the original state array in place. When setSections(reordered) is called on line 112, React sees the same object reference and skips the re-render.

Fix: Change line 109 from 'const reordered = sections' to 'const reordered = [...sections]' to create a shallow clone before mutating.
